issue.title: [Python] Documentation: Wrong default value
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-14796](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14796). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
On the documentation for {_}to_string{_}, [link](https://arrow.apache.org/docs/python/generated/pyarrow.Table.html?highlight=show_metadata#pyarrow.Table.to_string), the function signature has the correct default value. Nevertheless, the parameter text mistakenly mentions "{_}default True{_}"

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14796?focusedCommentId=17447890) by Joris Van den Bossche (jorisvandenbossche):*
`[~zoistas]` thanks for the report! 
Interested in doing a pull request to fix this?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14796?focusedCommentId=17448368) by Zois Tasoulas (zoistas):*
`[~jorisvandenbossche]` Sure, I opened PR [11762.](https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11762)

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14796?focusedCommentId=17448640) by Krisztian Szucs (kszucs):*
Issue resolved by pull request 11762
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11762>
